key_risks: Competitive pressures from established players like Intuit QuickBooks and Sage
Data privacy and security concerns due to handling sensitive financial data
Dependence on key markets (Australia, New Zealand, and the UK) for revenue
Regulatory challenges from varying global compliance requirements
Customer service issues, including overpayments and invoice reconciliation errors
controversies: Reports of overpayments and invoice reconciliation errors
Potential gaps in customer service and platform functionality
environmental_issues: Commitment to becoming a net-zero carbon emissions company by 2030
social_issues: Customer service issues affecting user satisfaction and retention
governance_issues: Regulatory compliance challenges, including tax compliance and data protection laws

sources.title: ordinary pay adjustment - Xero Central
sources.snippet: HI Anna. If it's the most recent pay then you can Revert it back to draft (under options in the payrun) and fix it, then repost. If it's not practical to Revert back, then use an Unscheduled Payrun to do a "journal" to show the movement of hours from Ordinary to ACC.

sources.title: Overpayment as customer paid for one invoice twice - Xero
sources.snippet: Xero won't allow you to reconcile the payment as the original invoice is marked as paid and it won't find it in the 'matching system'. If you attempt to do it from within the invoice itself, there is no option to 'add a payment' because once again, the invoice is shown as fully paid.
